intro: Aeginetia sekimotoana, commonly known as the Sekimoto's aeginetia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsule fruits that release tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
